fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.sort

Interface ISortBuilder


  • public interface ISortBuilder
    Builds a sort definition that can be applied to lists fetched from a connector data source.

    Thread-safety: implementations of this interface are not required to be safe for concurrent access. Therefore, processing should generally not be shared between multiple threads.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IListStructure.buildSort()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ISortBuilder add(Order order, ICell cell)
      Adds a cell to the sort definition being built, specifying the order.
      ISort importSort(InputStream stream)
      Imports a sort definition by reading data from a stream.
      ISort importSort(Object representation)
      Imports a sort definition by converting a supported object type to a sort instance.
      ISort toSort()
      Creates an immutable sort definition that can be applied to the associated connector data source.

    • Method Detail

      • toSort

        ISort toSort()
        Creates an immutable sort definition that can be applied to the associated connector data source.
        Returns:
        the sort definition, constructed as an immutable snapshot of the current state of the sort builder.
        Since:
        1.0

      • add

        ISortBuilder add(Order order,
                 ICell cell)
          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a cell to the sort definition being built, specifying the order. Sorting priority is defined by the order in which cells are added. Attempting to add a cell that has already been added has no effect on the sort being built (such attempts are ignored).
        Parameters:
        order - the sorting order.
        cell - the non-cell to add. It can be from any source with which the current source can be joined or merged when building a list.
        Returns:
        this sort builder, to continue adding sortable cells or to convert to an immutable sort definition object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the cell or order may not be used in the context of the associated data source.
        Since:
        1.0

      • importSort

        ISort importSort(InputStream stream)
          throws IOException
        Imports a sort definition by reading data from a stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - non-null stream to read from. The stream will not be closed by this method.
        Returns:
        the imported sort definition.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the definition cannot be imported from the supplied stream.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ISort.exportSort(java.io.OutputStream)

      • importSort

        ISort importSort(Object representation)
        Imports a sort definition by converting a supported object type to a sort instance.
        Parameters:
        representation - non-null object that can be converted to an instance of ISort by this implementation.
        Returns:
        the imported sort definition.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the requested conversion is not supported by this implementation.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ISort.exportSortAs(Class)
